definition: same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly

sentences.english: Euphemism is a social linguistic phenomenon, which is able to reflect the contained cultural implications.
sentences.chinese: 委婉语是人类语言使用过埕中的一种普遍现象。

sentences.english: The inflated style itself is a kind of euphemism.
sentences.chinese: 这种华而不实的风格本身就是一种委婉语。

sentences.english: I learned to use a soft voice to oil my words.
sentences.chinese: 我已学会用柔音使自已的吐字圆润委婉。

sentences.english: That woman is tactful on smiling, for if flower without foundation bloom.
sentences.chinese: 那女子委婉一笑，犹如凭空绽放的花朵。

sentences.english: There are over 200 euphemisms for death in the English language.
sentences.chinese: 英语里，死的委婉说法超过200个。

sentences.english: But it's a very non-affrontive way to pose the question.
sentences.chinese: 但这是一种委婉的提问方式。

sentences.english: Secondly, the formation mechanism for English euphemism is metonymy rather than metaphor.
sentences.chinese: 第二，委婉语的构成机制是转喻而非隐喻。

sentences.english: Expressions are a frequently used pragmatic strategy of politeness language in the international business negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 委婉表达是商务谈判中一种常见的礼貌语言语用策略。

sentences.english: Before his crash Matej's use of the English language was broken, to put it mildly.
sentences.chinese: 说得委婉一点，梅特库斯撞车前的英语是不连贯的。

sentences.english: The Feng dances tactfully occasion of unraveling the feudal title.
sentences.chinese: 凤舞委婉地解释了爵位的由来。

sentences.english: Yun Shouping also had a congenial line in veiled political comment.
sentences.chinese: 恽寿平也曾在一句寓意诗中委婉地表达政治见解。

sentences.english: Your tactful to leave by boat.
sentences.chinese: 你委婉的作别，乘船离去。

sentences.english: The how euphemistic website that publicizes you to people or your product.
sentences.chinese: 怎么委婉的向人们宣传你的网站或你的产品。

sentences.english: Euphemism is long-standing linguistic and cultural phenomenon in every nation.
sentences.chinese: 委婉语是各个民族长期的语言和文化现象。

sentences.english: Euphemistic Expressions are a frequently used pragmatic strategy of politeness language in the international business negotiation.
sentences.chinese: 委婉表达是商务谈判中一种常见的礼貌语言语用策略。

definition: to contain/to hold/(of a person or style etc) reserved/restrained/(of words, writings) full of hidden meaning/implicit/veiled (criticism)
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
variant of 言辭|言辞[yan2 ci2]
